department.dept_long_name: Committee on Higher Degrees in Biological Sciences in Public Health

course.title: Molecular Signals to Understand Exposure Biology
course.description: This course will offer students a deeper understanding of molecular signals often termed, as "Biomarkers" that serve as highly useful tools for understanding the biology of the disease as well as nature and extent of human exposure from environmental contaminants and drugs. The course is divided in 4 modules: 1) Biomarker discovery, 2) Organ/Disease specific biomarkers, 3) Multiscale technologies for biomarker quantitation, and 4) Clinical and statistical considerations in biomarker research.
course.notes: Offered jointly with School of Public Heath as EH 527.
